channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Money Matters: Navigating Small Business Taxes
item.description: Become one of the first subscribers. Freelancers often open LLCs, which can protect your personal assets from business debt. You might need to make estimated tax payments quarterly. Let a tax pro take it to the finish line for at least the first couple of years. Every expense you incur—from software to coffees with clients—goes in the software. ) Pick one that creates functional invoices, makes inputting expenses easy, and is in your budget.
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: August 7
item.description: It estimates that 2.5 million weddings will take place next year, compared to an average of 2.1 million weddings/year pre-pandemic and 1.2 million weddings in 2020. ! (The Atlantic)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Dixie Fire Becomes Third-Largest Fire in California History
item.description: The Dixie Fire in California became the third-largest fire in state history yesterday.  Turkey has also suffered from its worst wildfires in decades for the last 10 days. Southern Europe is also burning.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: US Hiring Surges as Employers Add 943,000 Jobs in July
item.description: “I have yet to find a blemish in this jobs report. US employers added 943,000 jobs in July, marking the best monthly performance since August 2020, and the unemployment rate ticked down to 5.4% from 5.9% in June.   The motion picture and sound recording industries had 30.1% fewer jobs in July than in February 2020.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Singapore Goes Ahead With Relaxing Curbs as Countries Learn to Live With Covid
item.description: without new mitigation measures. Compare that to the more lax approach employed by countries like the US and the UK. Why it matters: Singapore is the most significant example yet of a country pivoting from a “Covid Zero” approach to a strategy that accepts Covid as “endemic,” meaning it’s always present but remains at a manageable level. “Living with Covid”Before its pivot, Singapore was part of a group of Asia-Pacific countries that played Whac-A-Mole to snuff out any trace of the coronavirus in an approach known as “Zero Covid.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: August 7
item.description: It estimates that 2.5 million weddings will take place next year, compared to an average of 2.1 million weddings/year pre-pandemic and 1.2 million weddings in 2020. ! (The Atlantic)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Money Matters: Navigating Small Business Taxes
item.description: Become one of the first subscribers. Freelancers often open LLCs, which can protect your personal assets from business debt. You might need to make estimated tax payments quarterly. Every expense you incur—from software to coffees with clients—goes in the software. —HaleyBefore taking on clients, you’ll need to form a legal business, which matters in part because your structure determines how you’re taxed. ) Pick one that creates functional invoices, makes inputting expenses easy, and is in your budget.
item.author: Ryan Lasker

item.title: US Hiring Surges as Employers Add 943,000 Jobs in July
item.description: Still, the US economy remains 5.7 million jobs short of where it was pre-pandemic, and jobs in some industries may never come back...  “I have yet to find a blemish in this jobs report. Motion picture and sound recording industries had 30.1% fewer jobs in July than in Feb 2020.

item.title: Singapore Goes Ahead With Relaxing Curbs as Countries Learn to Live With Covid
item.description: Compare that to the more lax approach employed by countries like the US and the UK. without new mitigation measures. Why it matters: Singapore is the most significant example yet of a country pivoting from a “Covid Zero” approach to a strategy that accepts Covid as “endemic,”  which means it’s always present but remains at a manageable level. “Living with Covid”Before its pivot, Singapore was part of a group of Asian-Pacific countries that played Whac-A-Mole to snuff out any trace of the coronavirus in an approach known as “Zero Covid.”

item.title: Dixie Fire Becomes Third-Largest Fire in California History
item.description: The Dixie Fire in California became the third-largest fire in state history yesterday.  Turkey has also experienced its worst wildfires in decades for the last 10 days. Southern Europe is also burning.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Make It Work: I'm a Little Lost
item.description: The first thing you should ask yourself is whether it’s a specific aspect of your current job that you dislike, or if it’s the line of work that you find unfulfilling. Most people who haven’t found a job that they are passionate about have stopped looking for one. Pick up a book on something you know nothing about (the Brew has a whole shelf full of recs). I don't like my current job but I have no idea what I would rather do instead. Some of the most interesting 40-year-olds still don’t.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Shein is the Fastest-Growing E-commerce Company You’ve Maybe Never Heard Of
item.description: Now that you’re listening, here’s the backgroundShein is an online-only, fast-fashion retailer based in China, with a focus on women’s apparel. Fast fashion 2.0, known as “ultra-fast fashion” and popularized by brands like ASOS and Boohoo, got that process down to a week or two. Shein turns around a new design in as little as three days. As factory production gears up, Shein. If you’re not a Gen Z woman with a penchant for online shopping, you may have never heard of the world’s fastest-growing e-commerce company, Shein. If you are in that demographic, the brand likely follows you around the internet like an overly attached chihuahua. But moving this fast has resulted in Shein breaking things. An in-house design team then sends it to a Shein supplier located in China’s manufacturing hub, Guangzhou.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Icebreakers with...Erika Thompson of Texas Beeworks
item.description: But she’s most famous for documenting her calm bee removal services on TikTok.After strapping into a bee suit, we asked Thompson a few Icebreakers—but please, don’t try this at home. I was in orchestra, I was the captain of my high school bowling team, and I loved Star Wars. Then, one day I was sitting at work at my office job and I opened my email and saw a note from Jeopardy! And then after many, many other things, I'm putting together social content.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Stock Watch: Running Shoes
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: August 6
item.description: (Oliver Burkeman) Read: The three-or-four-hours rule for getting creative work done.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Mattel Debuts Barbies in Likenesses of Frontline Health Workers
item.description: They all have Barbie dolls in their likenesses. Why it matters: Mattel had been criticized for depicting an unrealistic portrait of womanhood with its original white, blonde doll, which turned 60 in 2019. What does Covid-19 vaccine developer Sarah Gilbert have in common with Beyoncé and Marilyn Monroe?
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: BlackRock, Wells Fargo, and Amazon Latest Companies to Push Back Office Reopenings Due to Delta Surge
item.description: Google and Apple moved their office return to October and Google said that all employees who want to come in will need to be vaccinated. Both banks brought employees back to the office earlier this summer and said this week that they haven’t changed their return-to-work policies.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Biden Calls Pushes Auto Industry Toward Electrification
item.description: Still, the US is behind the global EV curve:Electric cars currently make up just 2% of new auto sales in the US, compared to 6% in China and 10% in Europe.  In a show of solidarity with the White House, the automakers pledged to make electric vehicle sales 40%–50% of their total by 2030... Biden’s goal is to cut emissions by 50% below 2005 levels by the end of the decade, and to do that he’s targeting transportation, the industry accounting for 29% of all US emissions.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: (Pioneer Works) Read: Beauty and solace in the abandoned worlds of Roblox. Here’s a video of the first two hours of the network, which includes some incredible music.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Is Robinhood the Newest Memestock?
item.description: Robinhood was the No. 1 stock mentioned on Reddit’s WallStreetBets forum, and was also the most traded stock on Fidelity. Increased options activity has been a hallmark of meme stock mania, and accounted for 46% of Robinhood’s revenue in 2020. Here’s some evidence:Total retail volume for Robinhood increased about 10x on Tuesday from the previous day.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Why the Heck Are Olympic Track Stars Smashing So Many World Records?
item.description: Olympic track stars are running like they’re members of the Cullen family, shattering world records in Tokyo this week.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Spikes in Covid Cases Among Children Have Some Officials Worried for Back-to-School
item.description: Dr. Fauci said in May that by Q1 2022 we’ll have enough data to begin vaccinating kids of all ages. Looking ahead... But severe illness from Covid is still pretty rare among children, making up about 1.3%–3.5% of hospitalizations during the pandemic.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Uber and Lyft Back New Gig Worker Ballot Proposal in Massachusetts
item.description: Big Gig has set up lobbying groups in five additional states in the last few months to challenge worker reclassification attempts that threaten their business models. Looking ahead... It passed after the companies spent more than $205 million promoting it—a record sum for a California ballot measure.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Taking Action: Your Guide to Active Fixed Income
item.description: Active bond funds are great portfolio components because they can diversify portfolios in a time of market uncertainty. Active bond funds can have more taxable returns than other funds. When managing an active fund, the portfolio manager uses their research and expertise to hand-select stocks or bonds for the fund. Hot dog, because we’re here to give you the FYI on active fixed income funds (or active bond funds) —and why you should consider adding them to your portfolio. So active bond funds’ low costs and fees can help you hold on to more of your initial investment while you wait. Their strategic selection of funds can help your investments blossom within the market.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: PepsiCo Plans to Sell Off Tropicana, Naked, And Other Juice Brands
item.description: Blame it on the C6H12O6 Despite a brief uptick in fruit juice sales last year (Vitamin C for immunity, more time for breakfast), the category is suffering the same long-term decline as sugary cereals.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: August 4
item.description: Dylan Boigris, a 2016 Miami Law graduate, began his career making about $45,000 as a public defender. I thought I would come out making much more than I did.” (Vanity Fair) Read: A profile of the original influencer, Sean Combs.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Beijing Calls Online Gaming “Opium For the Mind,” Shares of Tencent Plunge
item.description: 40% of Fortnite maker Epic Games 12% of Snap 5% of Tesla  5% of Activision Blizzard Bottom line: International investors burned by China’s regulatory bombshells have lost more than $1 trillion this year. Its investment stakes include...  Tencent may not be a household name in the US, but its fingerprints are all over the American tech industry.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: NYC, Tyson, and Microsoft Announce Vaccine Mandates
item.description: Meanwhile, masks won’t be required indoors because, according to de Blasio, they could disincentivize New Yorkers from getting the vaccine. Meat supplier Tyson will require all of its 120,000 US workers to be vaccinated. That divide’s best illustrated by Walmart, where only corporate workers need to show proof of vaccination.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: SEC Chief Gary Gensler Calls Crypto the "Wild West" in Speech
item.description: To clean things up, Gensler asked Congress for more resources to police the crypto world, such as the authority to monitor crypto exchanges.  Regulation should be welcome in crypto, Gensler said, because it sets guardrails and can pave the way for success. The market is worth about $1.6 trillion, Gensler said. Why does it matter what Gensler thinks?  But here’s something you may not know: Gensler is kind of a crypto nerd himself.  As the country’s top financial regulator, he could hand down the most significant rules for the crypto industry to date.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: SEC Chief Gary Gensler Calls Crypto the "Wild West" in Speech
item.description: To clean things up, Gensler asked Congress for more resources to police the crypto world, such as the authority to monitor crypto exchanges. The market is worth about $1.6 trillion, Gensler said.  But here’s something you may not know: Gensler is kind of a crypto nerd himself. Why does it matter what Gensler thinks?  As the country’s top financial regulator, he could hand down the most significant rules for the crypto industry to date.  Regulation should be welcome in crypto, Gensler said, because it sets guardrails and can pave the way for success.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: So You Wanna Be a Cryptonaire
item.description: Only 14% of people in the US have crypto investments, according to crypto exchange Gemini, and the market is still a pea compared to the global stock and bond markets.   Cryptocurrency isn’t just bitcoin. If you want to invest in crypto or other assets, that’s fine and dandy. But if you’re looking to diversify your portfolio and put some money in a new asset class, do some research and try starting small. The bear case: There’s a lot of speculation happening in the crypto market, and while some cryptocurrencies post huge gains, they can also be incredibly volatile. which you should already have after setting your initial investment and retirement strategy. If you sell a crypto asset, use it to purchase goods/services, or trade it for another cryptocurrency, any profit you make is probably subject to a capital gains tax (which varies based on how long the asset is held).  Just please don’t put your life savings in dogecoin. Cryptocurrency can be the bulk of those riskier investments or just a slice—but it shouldn’t be the majority of your portfolio. For crypto novices, numerous financial advisors recommend starting off with a very small allocation (1%–2%) of your portfolio in crypto. The IRS taxes cryptocurrency transactions similarly to property.   Bottom line: Unlike pairing black socks with brown loafers, there isn’t a correct answer about whether you should invest in crypto today.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Blackstone-backed Firm to Buy Reese Witherspoon’s Media Company
item.description: One potential target: LeBron James and Maverick Carter's SpringHill production company. Blackstone is bankrolling the media venture with $2 billion, so Mayer and Staggs are on the hunt for other acquisitions.
item.author: Matty Merritt
